comments:
Build: i20040121

Having a plug-in project with a bogus manifest does not allow the user to create
Ant build files for any other plug-in.

Steps:
1 - create a plug-in project AAA with no content (only .project and plugin.xml)
2 - edit the plug-in manifest file to be:
<plugin> </plugin>
(new plug-ins will use the plug-in manifest file only to declare
extension/extension points).
3 - now try to create an Ant build file for any other plug-in: a message saying
that there is parsing error in the AAA plug-in is shown, and no build file is
produced. In my opinion, this is a bug. If a plug-in do not require the faulty
plug-in, its build file should be properly generated. Closing the bogus project
will not help. Deleting it will cause a NPE next time I try to create a Ant
build file. Here is the log containg entries for the parsing error and for the NPE:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.build 2 4 Jan 27, 2004 13:39:40.202
!MESSAGE Plug-in parsing problems.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 Jan 27, 2004 13:39:40.202
!MESSAGE Name attribute missing from plug-in or fragment at
"file:d:/target_instances/releasing/AAA/plugin.xml".
!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.ui 4 0 Jan 27, 2004 13:40:41.358
